pr_title: Log expected STREAM_CLOSED exceptions for already closed streams at FINE level

timeline.bodyText: Do we need a null check for http2Ex or are you sure it will never be null in this context?
timeline.author: sanjaypujare

replies.bodyText: It shouldn't be null. Netty doesn't guarantee that all that well, but Netty itself assumes it is non-null and there's no reason for it to be null.
replies.author: ejona86

timeline.bodyText: Let's use FINE only if serverStream == null as well. Really, connection().stream(Http2Exception.streamId(http2Ex)) == null is the more precise check, but serverStream == null is pretty close and is easy, and I don't think will mislead readers.
timeline.author: ejona86

replies.bodyText: Do you mean changing the condition to serverStream == null && http2Ex.error() == Http2Error.STREAM_CLOSED?
replies.author: lriuui0x0

replies.bodyText: Yes, effectively. And the logging lines would need to move slightly. It may be good to use an if, but whatever.
replies.author: ejona86

replies.bodyText: @ejona86 Cool I have made the suggested change!
replies.author: lriuui0x0

timeline.bodyText: This won't build. serverStream is defined on the next line. The lines will need to be swapped.
timeline.author: ejona86

replies.bodyText: @ejona86 I have pushed the fix. Please review again.
replies.author: lriuui0x0

replies.bodyText: Because the serverStream code was moved up to line 535 one unintended consequence is that if that code throws exception (not sure if it ever will) the logger.log line will never execute now (which was executing before this change) so we'll not see a log message that used to come out before this change. One way to address it is to put try-catch around line 535. Just pointing it out.
replies.author: sanjaypujare

replies.bodyText: That line to get the stream is fairly safe. There may be a few edge cases, but I'm not that worried as there is very little code (transitively) and we'd be seeing NPEs already.
replies.author: ejona86
